thread.title: Food and Wine News: Vineyard Walks, an Ex-Gangster Talks
thread.title_full: Food and Wine News: Vineyard Walks, an Ex-Gangster Talks - The New York Times

author: Shivani Vora
title: Food and Wine News: Vineyard Walks, an Ex-Gangster Talks
text:
Our Thursday morning dining digest, with deals, tips and anything else that travelers may want to know.
WINE AND WALKING IN OREGON
Winery visits are a longtime tradition, but Sokol Blosser Winery in the Willamette Valley in Oregon is going beyond the usual with its new vineyard hikes. The half-day excursion starts with a three-mile trek through the 120-acre estate full of hills and dirt trails. A winery staff member leads the walks and educates guests along the way on the winery’s history, geology of the land, grape varietals and the organic farming practices it uses. A lunch highlighting local cheese and produce and a flight tasting of four wines, a mix of red and white, is included. The cost is $75 per person.
A HIGH-PROFILE CHICAGO PROJECT FROM HIGH-PROFILE NEW YORKERS
